content:
• Tuesday, January 10, 2012
  • PRZM

    Internet Patents Corporation (PTNT), formerly InsWeb (NASDAQ:INSW), announces a special cash...

    Internet Patents Corporation (PTNT), formerly InsWeb (NASDAQ:INSW), announces a special cash distribution of $5.00 per common share, for a total distribution payment of $33m based on approximately 6m outstanding shares. Shares +12.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • BORN

    China New Borun (NYSE:BORN) says it's BORN) today reported that it has signed pre-sales...

    China New Borun (NYSE:BORN) says it's signed pre-sales contracts worth 90% of its total edible alcohol production capacity in 2012. Shares +10.45% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (NYSE:MPC) -1.7% AH after saying it expects to report a "small" Q4 loss vs....

    Marathon Petroleum (NYSE:MPC) -1.7% AH after saying it expects to report a "small" Q4 loss vs. $1.00 consensus EPS, as prices for refined petroleum products failed to keep up with increasing crude costs. Refiners have been hit hard by high crude prices; last week, Tesoro (TSO) also warned it would report a Q4 loss.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • RGLD

    Royal Gold (NASDAQ:RGLD) falls 4.1% AH after announcing a 4M share stock offering - good for...

    Royal Gold (NASDAQ:RGLD) falls 4.1% AH after announcing a 4M share stock offering - good for proceeds of $283.7M as of today's close. The gold royalty trust says it will use the offering's proceeds to acquire "additional royalty or similar interests," to "fund near-term obligations" related to a recent acquisition, and to repay debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC +5.7%) led all S&P gainers today and has easily outperformed the index...

    Bank of America (BAC +5.7%) led all S&P gainers today and has easily outperformed the index so far this year, and Bret Jensen expects the momentum to continue throughout 2012. He cites the housing market finally hitting bottom, a continuing drop in loan-loss provisions, and good progress in shoring up its capital levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) raises its FY11 sales guidance, now saying it expects revenue to be...

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) raises its FY11 sales guidance, now saying it expects revenue to be in the range from $690M - $695M, compared to $494M over the same period last year. Prior revenue guidance was for $685M - $690M. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • DLA

    Delta Apparel (NYSEMKT:DLA) plunges 16% AH after warning it expects FQ2 revenue of $105M, below...

    Delta Apparel (NYSEMKT:DLA) plunges 16% AH after warning it expects FQ2 revenue of $105M, below a $113M consensus. Delta also says it will take a $1.20/share inventory charge during the quarter. Excluding the charge, Delta's EPS is expected to be in the range of -$0.38 to -$0.42, much worse than a $0.02 consensus. For FY12, Delta now expects revenue of $480M-$500M and EPS of $1.70-$1.80, below a consensus of $514.6M and $2.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors Investment (NYSE:TWO) announces a 25M share secondary offering, with Credit Suisse...

    Two Harbors Investment (NYSE:TWO) announces a 25M share secondary offering, with Credit Suisse acting as lead book-running manager. Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • SNX

    More on Synnex (NYSE:SNX): Q4 beats across-the-board as earnings jumped 34% Y/Y on continued...

    More on Synnex (NYSE:SNX): Q4 beats across-the-board as earnings jumped 34% Y/Y on continued strong sales growth and better margins. The company also reafirms its guidance in-line with Street estimates. Shares +2.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • CWTR

    Struggling women's apparel retailer Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) falls 6.8% AH after warning it...

    Struggling women's apparel retailer Coldwater Creek (NASDAQ:CWTR) falls 6.8% AH after warning it expects FQ4 (ends in January) EPS of -$0.18 to -$0.24, worse than a consensus of -$0.17. The weak performance is the result of poor same-store sales - down 9% Y/Y as of Dec. 31. Coldwater plans to deliver its Q4 report on March 7.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • CROX

    Crox (NASDAQ:CROX) expects Q4 revenue to come in on the high end of its previously-issued...

    Crox (NASDAQ:CROX) expects Q4 revenue to come in on the high end of its previously-issued guidance of $200M-$205M, which it says should help push FY11 revenue over the $1B threshold. Shares up 4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) drops 11.9% AH after announcing CEO Glen T. Senk has resigned....

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) drops 11.9% AH after announcing CEO Glen T. Senk has resigned. Senk, who had held the title since 2007, will be replaced by Chairman Dick Hayne - a move that's likely to stir speculation that Senk was pushed out.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +8.6%) is trading higher today after announcing successful...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +8.6%) is trading higher today after announcing successful top-line results from its first clinical study testing its combination of LX4211 and DPP-4, one of the most widely used diabetes drugs. Results showed a greater reduction in blood sugar levels after meals in type 2 diabetes patients than with just the DPP-4 inhibitor alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • NTR

    BMO ups a couple agricultural fertilizer companies today on valuation, saying that agricultural...

    BMO ups a couple agricultural fertilizer companies today on valuation, saying that agricultural prices and fertilizer costs relative to farmer revenues remain very attractive. The firm ups Agrium (AGU +3.6%) and CF Industries (CF +3.9%) to Outperform (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • RYL

    Ryland Group (RYL +5%) pops after JP Morgan upped the shares to Overweight on valuation earlier...

    Ryland Group (RYL +5%) pops after JP Morgan upped the shares to Overweight on valuation earlier today, citing its potential for above average order growth in 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • VRTS

    Shares of Virtus Investment Partners (VRTS +7.3%) shoot higher after S&P announces that the...

    Shares of Virtus Investment Partners (VRTS +7.3%) shoot higher after S&P announces that the company will be added to its Midcap 400 Index. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • COF

    FBR's Scott Valentin adds Capital One (COF +3.2%) to his "Top Picks" list, saying the credit...

    FBR's Scott Valentin adds Capital One (COF +3.2%) to his "Top Picks" list, saying the credit card lender's pending acquisitions of ING Direct and HSBC's U.S. credit card portfolio "increase confidence" in 2013 earnings. Valentin believes the two acquisitions "have the potential to add over $1.00 of EPS growth to our FY12 core EPS estimate of $6.35 in FY13."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +6.3%) gets a pop after Susquehanna initiates the stock with a Positive rating...

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +6.3%) gets a pop after Susquehanna initiates the stock with a Positive rating and $31 price target following its spin-off from Expedia (EXPE +3%), noting its solid travel content and high traffic rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • SKX

    Shares of Skechers (SKX +8.7%) soar, perhaps buoyed on word that the company is lining up...

    Shares of Skechers (SKX +8.7%) soar, perhaps buoyed on word that the company is lining up another Super Bowl commercial during the coveted two-minute warning time slot. Last year, the firm landed a lot of attention (and sales?) after a steamy ad featuring Kim Kardashian became water cooler material.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (ADSK +4.4%) moves higher after entering into a strategic alliance with Pitney Bowes...

    Autodesk (ADSK +4.4%) moves higher after entering into a strategic alliance with Pitney Bowes (PBI +1%) to provide information resources, services and solutions to help infrastructure owners and architecture, engineering and construction organizations with their decisionmaking.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical's (DOW +3%) wholly owned subsidiary Dow AgroSciences announces a multiyear research...

    Dow Chemical's (DOW +3%) wholly owned subsidiary Dow AgroSciences announces a multiyear research agreement with Germany's Fraunhofer Institute for Molecular Ecology. Under the terms of the agreement, both parties will collaborate on projects to develop novel biotechnology approaches to improve and enhance crops.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • HRC

    Hill-Rom Holdings (HRC +2.3%) gains after S&P ups credit rating a notch further into...

    Hill-Rom Holdings (HRC +2.3%) gains after S&P ups credit rating a notch further into investment-grade territory, saying it expects sustained sales growth and solid margins from the hospital-bed supplier.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CIE

    Shares of Cobalt International Energy (CIE +17.8%) shoot straight up after Morgan Stanley...

    Shares of Cobalt International Energy (CIE +17.8%) shoot straight up after Morgan Stanley dramatically doubles its price target to $38 from $19 - marking 103% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • BCOR

    InfoSpace (INSP +5%) trades up on positive comments out of Benchmark, saying the company's...

    InfoSpace (INSP +5%) trades up on positive comments out of Benchmark, saying the company's likely to not have to pay federal cash taxes for years in the wake of its purchase of TaxAct. Benchmark calls the deal "transformative" and a significant profit booster for the internet-search company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • TAP

    Coors Light (TAP +1.8%) surpasses Budweiser (BUD +0.4%) to become the no. 2 beer in the U.S.,...

    Coors Light (TAP +1.8%) surpasses Budweiser (BUD +0.4%) to become the no. 2 beer in the U.S., capping years of declines by Budweiser, the only full-calorie beer in the top five U.S. beers. Bud Light is the top-selling beer by a wide margin. Coors Light has been posting slow but steady growth, with sales up 0.8% while Bud sales fell 4.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • HITK

    Shares of Hi-Tech Pharmacal (HITK -18.1%) fall off sharply after rival Wockhardt says it landed...

    Shares of Hi-Tech Pharmacal (HITK -18.1%) fall off sharply after rival Wockhardt says it landed FDA approval for a generic copy of GlaxoSmithKline's Flonase nasal spray in a development that could dampen sales of the firm's own generic offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Volatile Pandora (P +9.5%) is surging again today. Shares received a lift yesterday from a...

    Volatile Pandora (P +9.5%) is surging again today. Shares received a lift yesterday from a bullish Needham report, and from the company's release of encouraging listener data. Pandora claims it now has more than 125M registered users (though active users are much lower), and, in spite of growing competition, holds a 68% share of the U.S. Internet radio market - up from 66% during its last fiscal quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • GSIT

    GSI Technology (GSIT +2.6%) moves up after saying FQ3 revenue will exceed its earlier forecast,...

    GSI Technology (GSIT +2.6%) moves up after saying FQ3 revenue will exceed its earlier forecast, as sales to Cisco, its largest customer, increased from the preceding quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • ILMN

    While Illumina (ILMN +3.9%) has rebounded from the weakness caused by Life Technologies' (LIFE...

    While Illumina (ILMN +3.9%) has rebounded from the weakness caused by Life Technologies' (LIFE +7.2%) product announcement, smaller rival Complete Genomics' (GNOM -19.9%) bloodletting worsens as the day progresses. On Monday, the company announced it delivered 300 fewer genomes in Q4 than previously expected, news that triggered a downgrade from Oppenheimer.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • RTI

    RTI International Metals (RTI +10.9%) jumps after agreeing to buy Remmele Engineering for around...

    RTI International Metals (RTI +10.9%) jumps after agreeing to buy Remmele Engineering for around $182M, in an effort to build up its offerings to the aerospace and defense markets and expand into the medical device sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +2.8%) trades up after Deutsche Bank ups the shares to Buy, citing strong...

    EOG Resources (EOG +2.8%) trades up after Deutsche Bank ups the shares to Buy, citing strong production trends from the company's Eagle Ford program over the second half of 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • MEET

    Quepasa (QPSA) +6.9% after Rodman & Renshaw notes that Quantcast's data suggests traffic for...

    Quepasa (QPSA) +6.9% after Rodman & Renshaw notes that Quantcast's data suggests traffic for Quepasa's myYearbook.com site remains healthy. The firm sees Quepasa as a compelling play on the growth of the social networking space.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • HMA

    More on the turmoil at Health Management Associates (HMA -22.1%) (previous): The lawsuit that...

    More on the turmoil at Health Management Associates (HMA -22.1%) (previous): The lawsuit that has unsettled shares of HMA involves allegations made by a whistleblower who alleges that he was fired for reporting repeated Medicare overbilling issues. Though the drama adds to concerns over federal subpoenas the firm received earlier this year, Susquehanna's A.J. Rice sees opportunity in the panic-selling - telling clients an "extraordinary buying opportunity" exists.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • ILMN

    After opening sharply lower on fears of new competition from Life Technologies, Illumina (ILMN...

    After opening sharply lower on fears of new competition from Life Technologies, Illumina (ILMN -0.2%) has pared nearly all of the day's losses after announcing its HiSeq 2500 DNA sequencing system. Illumina claims the system, which will be available in 2H12, is capable of sequencing an entire genome in 24 hours, and will enable new applications for medical researchers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • GTIV

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -8%) and Amedisys (AMED -3.4%) are both lowered to Underperform...

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -8%) and Amedisys (AMED -3.4%) are both lowered to Underperform from Neutral at Robert W. Baird. The sector still seems to price in too optimistic an outlook for 2012, and investors materially underestimate the risk to therapy cuts, thus any negative announcement "could drive a material amount of downside" in shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • HGG

    Hhgreg (NYSE:HGG) slides 13.25% after it says FQ3 EPS fell to a prelim $0.60 from $0.66 and well...

    Hhgreg (NYSE:HGG) slides 13.25% after it says FQ3 EPS fell to a prelim $0.60 from $0.66 and well below consensus of $0.77, due to lower-than-expected margins in its video category and higher ad spending. Sales +27% to $829.5M, above forecasts. Hhgregg also cuts its FY 2012 EPS guidance to $1.05-$1.15; analysts expect $1.12. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI +5.3%) ROVI) today announced that it has signed a deal with Twitter to enhance its...

    Rovi (ROVI +5.3%) ROVI) today announced that it has signed a deal with Twitter to enhance its database of standardized information with the addition of verified accounts from Twitter.">signs a deal with Twitter to enhance its database of standardized information with the addition of verified accounts from Twitter.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • NYX

    The EU is set to nix the NYSE Euronext/Deutsche Boerse merger. The exchanges have signaled they...

    The EU is set to nix the NYSE Euronext/Deutsche Boerse merger. The exchanges have signaled they are committed to seeing the process through and are engaging in a vigorous lobbying campaign to reverse the decision. NYX +3.5%, OTCPK:DBOEY +3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • GT

    Comments from Goodyear Tire (GT -7.8%) CEO Richard Kramer that unseasonably warm weather is...

    Comments from Goodyear Tire (GT -7.8%) CEORichard Kramer that unseasonably warm weather is hurting winter tire sales lets the air out of shares, plunging 10%-plus in the past half-hour. Kramer says GTis on target to meet 2013 goals but recent trends have been challenging, with volume softness across all categories. Also, CTB -3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • OFIX

    Dutch orthopedic products maker Orthofix (OFIX +4.8%) jumps after reporting preliminary Q4 sales...

    Dutch orthopedic products maker Orthofix (OFIX +4.8%) jumps after reporting preliminary Q4 sales of $151.3M (+5% Y/Y), beating consensus by $0.9M. The company also says it's partnering with MTF to develop and commercialize technology for bone-grafting applications.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • VDSI-OLD

    Vasco Data Security (VDSI-OLD +13.8%) pops after Wunderlich ups the stock to Buy on valuation,...

    Vasco Data Security (VDSI-OLD +13.8%) pops after Wunderlich ups the stock to Buy on valuation, citing increased confidence in the company's enterprise business trends.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • UNG

    BofA sharply cuts its 2012 forecast for U.S. natural gas (UNG -3.5%) to an average $3.30/MMBtu,...

    BofA sharply cuts its 2012 forecast for U.S. natural gas (UNG -3.5%) to an average $3.30/MMBtu, down by $1. November and December saw the warmest winter weather in more than 30 years, the firm writes, “Thus, we are starting the new gas year with an incredible glut. This is not just bearish for 2012 but also for 2013."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • VOXX

    Electronics brand owner VOXX International (VOXX - formerly Audiovox) rises 23.7% after...

    Electronics brand owner VOXX International (VOXX - formerly Audiovox) rises 23.7% after reporting FQ3 (ended Nov. 30) revenue of $206.8M (+26.7%) and EPS of $0.38, blowing past a Street forecast of $173.4M and $0.18. VOXX's gross margin rose 120 bps Q/Q and 770 bps Y/Y, to 28.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA +4.3%) moves up after ThinkEquity initiates coverage with a Buy.

    NuVasive (NUVA +4.3%) moves up after ThinkEquity initiates coverage with a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • BRS

    Brostow Group (BRS +3.3%) moves up after Credit Suisse assumes coverage with an Outperform...

    Brostow Group (BRS +3.3%) moves up after Credit Suisse assumes coverage with an Outperform rating and a target price of $55. The firm says there are two catalysts that could push the stock higher in the near term: the monetization of Lider and winning the contract for GSAR-H, of which it expects both to happen this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • ARNA

    Arena (NASDAQ:ARNA) shoots up 10.3% on news the FDA has accepted its resubmitted application for...

    Arena (NASDAQ:ARNA) shoots up 10.3% on news the FDA has accepted its resubmitted application for the diet-drug lorcaserin. The agency is expected to decide whether to approve the treatment by June 27, having previously requested more information about its safety. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (SKUL -3%) sells off after reiterating its 2011 outlook ahead of an investor...

    Skullcandy (SKUL -3%) sells off after reiterating its 2011 outlook ahead of an investor conference. The headphone maker, whose shares are now down nearly 35% from their $20 IPO price, says it continues to expect 2011 revenue of $231M and EPS of $0.93, roughly in-line with consensus estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ZLC

    Profit warnings from Signet Jewelers and Tiffany's (I, II) cuts a wide swath on the sector,...

    Profit warnings from Signet Jewelers and Tiffany's (I, II) cuts a wide swath on the sector, tainting shares of jewelry sellers Zales (ZLC -4.4%), DGSE (DGSE -1.1%), and Blue Nile (NILE -4.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • BWA

    BorgWarner (BWA +10.3%) shares power higher after issuing upside FY12 EPS guidance and in-line...

    BorgWarner (BWA +10.3%) shares power higher after issuing upside FY12 EPS guidance and in-line revenue guidance. The supplier of engineered automotive systems and components sees EPS of $5.35-$5.65 vs. $5.21 consensus, revenues +10%-12% vs. ~12% consensus, and operating income margin of 11.5% or better, which would be a new record.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • MIPS

    MIPS (MIPS +3.2%) rallies for the second day in a row after showing off Ainol Electronics' Novo7...

    MIPS (MIPS +3.2%) rallies for the second day in a row after showing off Ainol Electronics' Novo7 Android tablet at CES. As previously announced, the tablet runs on a processor featuring a MIPS CPU core; the vast majority of rival solutions run on chips featuring ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) cores. At a $100 price point, the device (and the imitators likely to follow) might just be cheap to gain a following.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • TUDO

    Chinese online video company Tudou Holding (TUDO +8.3%) says it will integrate Digital Element's...

    Chinese online video company Tudou Holding (TUDO +8.3%) says it will integrate Digital Element's NetAcuity Edge, a hyperlocal targeting feature, into its site. The technology will enable it to identify user location to a specific town and city level, thereby enabling it to more efficiently customize its advertising.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • CRL

    Speculation that Charles River Laboratories (NYSE:CRL) is in play intensifies as management...

    Speculation that Charles River Laboratories (NYSE:CRL) is in play intensifies as management stays mum, shares are now up 22.8% without breaking stride.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • MANT

    Defense contractors ManTech (MANT +2.4%) and SAIC (SAI +3.3%) trade higher after announcing new...

    Defense contractors ManTech (MANT +2.4%) and SAIC (SAI +3.3%) trade higher after announcing new deals (I, II). ManTech says it has won a 3-year contract vide scientific and support services to DARPA, and SAIC says it has inked a deal to provide a variety of services to a federal systems integrator.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • FRAN

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (FRAN +21.4%) pop after the firm issues increased guidance after...

    Shares of Francesca's Holdings (FRAN +21.4%) pop after the firm issues increased guidance after knocking out strong holiday sales. The boutique retailer now calls for EPS for Q4 to fall in a range of $0.16-$0.17, up from its prior estimate of $0.14-$0.15.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • CEO

    Nexen (NXY) gushes 9.3% following the resignation of CEO Marvin Romanow and one of the company's...

    Nexen (NXY) gushes 9.3% following the resignation of CEO Marvin Romanow and one of the company's executive VPs. Shares have fallen sharply during the past year over concerns about Nexen's poorly performing C$6.1B ($5.94B) Long Lake oil sands project.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +3.9%) is rebounding following a dismal 2-week stretch that saw shares lose 18% of...

    Zynga (ZNGA +3.9%) is rebounding following a dismal 2-week stretch that saw shares lose 18% of their value. Unable to prevent a rally is Pac Crest's launching of coverage with a Hold. Analyst Evan Wilson says his "negative thesis" (shouldn't that justify a Sell?) stems from a high valuation, soft user base growth, and (echoing Dave Thier's concerns) the rising cost of simply maintaining Zynga's current user base.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • MAR

    Bank of America upgrades a few names in the hotel space, citing positive trends in cash flow,...

    Bank of America upgrades a few names in the hotel space, citing positive trends in cash flow, solid balance sheets and potential for dividend growth. It raises Marriott International (MAR +1.7%), Hyatt (H +2.8%) and La Salle Hotel (LHO +3.3%) all to Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • TSCO

    Tractor Supply (TSCO +2%) ticks up after Goldman upgrades the stock to Neutral and raises...

    Tractor Supply (TSCO +2%) ticks up after Goldman upgrades the stock to Neutral and raises estimates for its FY12/13 EPS to $3.44 - 3.98 from $3.30 -3.80, citing expectations for gross margin expansion.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM

  • Futures of frozen orange juice concentrate surge 9.3% to $2.12/pound, the highest price since...

    Futures of frozen orange juice concentrate surge 9.3% to $2.12/pound, the highest price since November 1977, due to concerns that small amounts of fungicide found in the beverage could limit supply.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • AUO

    Taiwanese display panel maker AU Optronics (AUO +8.7%), hit hard in 2011 by TV industry...

    Taiwanese display panel maker AU Optronics (AUO +8.7%), hit hard in 2011 by TV industry weakness, is rallying after reporting December sales of NT$27.7B ($925.2M). While the figure represents a 9.4% M/M and Y/Y drop, it was better than expected, and backs up positive comments made by AU's chairman in December. Rival LG Display (LPL +4.8%) is also up strongly.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • HMA

    The bloodbath continues for Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) as investors fret over the...

    The bloodbath continues for Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) as investors fret over the implications of a lawsuit filed by one if its ex-auditors. Shares are down 24.9%, extending losses tipped off in AH trading yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM +3.7%) unveils a smart-suit prototype with motion sensors that may help...

    STMicroelectronics (STM +3.7%) unveils a smart-suit prototype with motion sensors that may help people with injuries to recover faster and enhance the performance of athletes. STM is betting the technology used to record the movements of actors to create animated characters in films and games will have wider applications in sports and in helping recuperation from injury and illness.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN -7.5%) tails off on the open, as speculation picks up that Life Technologies may...

    Illumina (ILMN -7.5%) tails off on the open, as speculation picks up that Life Technologies may have beat it to the punch by bringing an affordable DNA reader to the market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • TIF

    Tiffany's (TIF -10.5%) profit warning takes a bite out of Harry Winston (HWD -1.8%). Tiffany is...

    Tiffany's (TIF -10.5%) profit warning takes a bite out of Harry Winston (HWD -1.8%). Tiffany is the largest customer of Winston's mining operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • TMO

    Shares of Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) shoot up 8.6% after the firm unveils at the CES show...

    Shares of Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) shoot up 8.6% after the firm unveils at the CES show in Las Vegas its new DNA reader that it says can sequence an entire genome in a single day for close to $1K.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL +2.9%) adds to its recent rally (I, II) after inking another licensing...

    Universal Display (PANL +2.9%) adds to its recent rally (I, II) after inking another licensing deal involving its OLED lighting technology.
